responsibilities: Design, build, and operate highly-available Kubernetes-based infrastructure for the hybrid cloud platform.
Build and operate tools and processes for fully-automated bare-metal Linux-based host provisioning.
Collaborate with internal customers to build self-service interfaces on the Platform.
Instrument and optimize system and cluster performance, including power consumption and network performance.
Forecast and plan capacity increases to ensure resource availability while meeting budget targets.
Provide thought leadership on DevOps and Platform Engineering-centric system and process design.
Mentor and help develop engineers on sister teams in a collaborative way.
Participate in an on-call rotation with fellow team members.
qualifications: Ability to automate processes using scripts, config management tools, and CI pipelines.
Solid understanding of networking fundamentals and storage technologies.
Strong communication skills and ability to publish easily understood documentation.
Problem-solving skills for new, ambiguous, or complex issues.
High standards in communication, feedback, continuous improvement, and operational excellence.
analysis: The job responsibilities and skills listed do not explicitly mention Generative AI (GenAI) or language models (LLMs). The responsibilities focus on designing, building, and operating Kubernetes-based infrastructure, automating processes, collaborating with internal customers, optimizing system performance, and providing thought leadership in DevOps and Platform Engineering. The skills required include automation, networking, communication, problem-solving, and experience with SaaS products. There is no indication of working with AI models, natural language processing, or any tasks related to GenAI or LLMs. The focus is more on infrastructure, DevOps, and platform engineering rather than AI or machine learning technologies.
